Title: The Provision of a Construction Industry Specific Two-Stage Open Book Supply Chain e-Procurement Tracking Database Service for Hampshire County Council's Major Construction Framework - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection for the provision of a Construction Industry Specific Two-Stage Open Book Supply Chain e-Procurement Tracking Database Service for Hampshire County Council's construction frameworks.
      
      HCC requires an externally hosted software system, as a service product built for the construction industry, with operational deployment during 2019.  It is anticipated that the solution is required to be fully implemented, tested and fully deployed by early 2020. 
      
      The database is intended to be used on all Southern Construction Framework projects, and should be cloud based, accessible via a browser-based secure log-in page to authorized users within and outside of HCC, able to offer varying levels of access to the data depending on the user type (framework manager, main contractor, sub-contractor, client), and be able to interact with other open-API government portals including Contracts Finder.
      
      HCC requires overarching view access to tenders etc. however third parties will be permitted to use the platform to advertise contract opportunities and manage the resultant procurement process. Multiple third parties will need to run multiple procurement exercises concurrently. HCC requires a specialist construction industry or similarly focussed standalone e-tender platform that allows tendering activity and related communications, and also project performance information to be gathered and analysed.
      
      The Contract will commence on 1st January 2020 and will be for a period of four years.
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 14.00 hrs on Monday 23rd September 2019.

Title: Hampshire & Southampton Advocacy Services - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council (the 'Council') invite suitably experienced providers to tender for the provision of a range of statutory and non-statutory advocacy service provision for vulnerable adults and children covering Hampshire and the city of Southampton.
      Hampshire County Council is conducting the procurement for both lots of service provision under the "Light Touch Regime" set out in Part 2, Chapter 3, Section 7 of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015, in accordance with the requirements of Hampshire County Council's Contract Standing Orders. The  procurement will consist of a single stage Open procedure. The service provision consists of 2 lots and Tenderers are required to bid on the basis that, if they are successful, they will deliver both lots. The initial contract term for Lot 1 Hampshire is 2 years, with the option to extend the contract at the discretion of Hampshire County Council, for a further period or periods not exceeding 2 years. The services will be procured through 2 single lots each provided under separate contracts to both the Council (Lot 1 Hampshire) and to Southampton City Council (Lot 2 Southampton) , the Council acting as lead authority for the procurement.  
      
      Advocacy  services to be delivered in both Lot 1 (Hampshire) and Lot 2 (Southampton) will include:
      · Independent Mental Health Advocacy (IMHA) as determined by the Mental Health Act 1983 (MHA) 
      · Independent Mental Capacity Act Advocacy (IMCA) including Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards (DOLS) IMCA, as determined by the Mental Capacity Act 2005 (MCA) and
      from 1st October 2020 - IMCA for Liberty Protection Safeguards (LPS) as introduced by the Mental Capacity Amendment Act 2019.
      · Paid Relevant Person's Representative (Paid RPR) as determined by the MCA.
      · Care Act Advocacy, as determined by the Care Act 2014.
       
      Additional advocacy  services to be delivered only in Lot 1 (Hampshire) will include:
      · Children's Statutory Advocacy, to be delivered under a range of legislation.
      · Non-statutory Advocacy for Adults
      · Non-statutory General Mental Health Advocacy
      · NHS Independent Health Complaints Advocacy Service: 
      
      Additional advocacy  services to be delivered only in Lot 2 (Southampton) will include:
      · Advocacy to support those with Special Educational Needs under the Children and Families Act (2014).
      ·Non-statutory advocacy to support Adults aged 18+. 
      ·Substance Use Disorder Services (SUDS) Advocacy
      ·Learning Disabilities Housing Advocacy
      
      The advocacy can be provided by instruction, or non-instructed when the person lacks the capacity or the competence, in the case of a child, to instruct. 
      The advocacy will include 1:1 work, group advocacy and support to enable peer advocacy and self advocacy.
      For specific details about the services being procured please see Document 6 Service Specification (Hampshire & Southampton) attached to this project.
      
      The anticipated service commencement date...

Title: Hampshire Carers Support & Dementia Advisors Service - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council invite suitably experienced providers to tender for the provision of services supporting carers and people living with dementia who live within the geographic jurisdiction of Hampshire County Council. 
      
      There will be four (4) contract lots of service provision. Three (3) of these contract lots will focus on the provision to carers and people living with dementia of a range of information, advice and support. The fourth lot ("Lot 4") will have a specific focus on working with carers to produce emergency plans for activation at such times when the carer is unable to undertake their caring role. 
      
      The breakdown of lots will be as follows, together with the annual contract value for each lot: 
      Lot 1: North Hampshire (incorporating the districts and boroughs of Basingstoke and Dene, Hart and Rushmoor). Annual contract value: £238,562 per annum.
      Lot 2: West Hampshire (incorporating the districts and boroughs of: Winchester, Test Valley, Eastleigh and the New Forest). Annual contract value: £380,256 per annum.
      Lot 3: East Hampshire (incorporating the Boroughs and Districts of East Hampshire, Havant, Fareham and Gosport). Annual contract value: £307,541 per annum.
      Lot 4: (Carers Emergency Planning Service, covering the geographic jurisdiction of Hampshire County Council). Annual contract value: £189,641 per annum. 
      The Council may exercise an option to purchase additional related services, including, but not limited to, the provision of services providing information, advice and support to carers in the context of hospital discharge up to the value of £300k and also for increased training delivery up to the value of £50k in any one year respectively.
      
      For all four lots, the service commencement date is 1st April 2019. 
      For each of the four lots the initial contract term is for a period of 3 years, with the option in each case, at the discretion of Hampshire County Council, to extend for a period or periods not exceeding two years.
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in AS12531 Hampshire Carers Support & Dementia Advisors Service via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire from Friday 26th October 2018 and must complete and submit the tender return documents together with any additional supporting information requested by 14.00 hrs / 2p.m. on Monday 3rd December 2018.

Title: Hitting The Cold Spots. - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council invite suitably experienced providers to tender for the provision across Hampshire of a home energy advice and associated support service (known as "Hitting The Cold Spots"). 
      
      The service will support Hampshire residents to efficiently and effectively keep their homes warm. 'Hitting The Cold Spots' improves health and wellbeing outcomes for residents living in, or at risk of, fuel poverty, particularly those whose health is most affected by a cold home. This is to be achieved through a combination of advice and support, and, for eligible residents, practical measures such as boiler repairs. This in turn reduces demand on health and social care services and helps to reduce excess winter deaths. Hampshire County Council will be running a one stage procurement process.  
      
      The anticipated service commencement date is 1st April 2019. The initial contract term is for a period of 3 years, with the option, at the discretion of Hampshire County Council, to extend for a period or periods not exceeding two years in total. The funding provided to the contract by Hampshire County Council will be a fixed figure of £120,000 per annum. The service provider will be expected to allocate annually from this £120,000 a minimum of £20,000 for use as discretionary funding ( to be spent only with the prior approval of the Council) to enable the installation of practical measures into residents' homes where no alternative source of external funding can be secured. The total maximum possible contract value over the contract term (and including any periods of contract extension) will equate to £600,000.
      
      Organisations interested in being considered for this opportunity will be required to register with and apply through Hampshire County Council's online tendering opportunities portal:
      https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire/
      
      The In-Tend project reference is AS12350 Hitting The Cold Spots and expressions of interest must be made using In-Tend from Tuesday 25th September  2018, with a deadline for submissions of 14:00 hours, Friday 2nd November 2018

Title: Hampshire Substance Misuse Treatment Service - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council intends to seek tenders for the provision of substance misuse services in Hampshire for adults and young people.  This will provide an opportunity for the transformation of substance misuse services, which will improve outcomes and maximise use of resources for all people living in Hampshire within the boundaries of Hampshire County Council. 
      
      The Hampshire County Council Service will consist of: 
      • an adult substance misuse treatment service (to include alcohol, opiate and non-opiates and other drugs such as psychoactive substances and image and performance enhancing drugs) which will provide both medical and psychosocial interventions
      • a young people's substance misuse service (for people up to the age of 25 years) 
      • a pharmacy drug-treatment service 
      
      The contract will be awarded for a period of 5 years with an option to extend for a further 2 years.

Title: Public Health & Clinical Commissioning Group Integrated Level 3 Sexual Health Services
Description:
Hampshire County Council, Portsmouth City Council and Southampton City Council are working in partnership with the local Clinical Commissioning Groups (CCGs) for West Hampshire, North Hampshire, North East Hampshire and Farnham, South Eastern Hampshire, Fareham and Gosport, Portsmouth and Southampton City, to collaboratively procure an Integrated model of Level 3 Sexual Health Services across this large geographical area.

The service will include the provision of local authority commissioned services for: Contraception (outside of the GP contract); Sexually Transmitted Infection (STI) Testing & Treatment; Chlamydia Screening; Psychosexual Counselling; Sexual Health Promotion & HIV Prevention Services; Outreach Services; Clinical & System Leadership; and CCG commissioned services for Termination of Pregnancy and Vasectomy
The deadline to submit your Tender (ITT) is 18 August  2016. 

A Provider Briefing Event will be held on 20 June 2016. In-Tend correspondence should be used to notify the Council of delegates’ names and contact details.

Please refer to the Read Me First (Provider Guidance) document for the full tender timeline. Anticipated contract start date is 1 April 2017. Contract term is for five years with options to extend for a period or periods not exceeding two years offering a potential contract term of 7 years in total. 

Anticipated contract values over the potential maximum contract term is £99,970,115 (£14,281,445 per annum). 

TUPE may apply.

All associated tender documentation is available now and all organisations interested in being considered for this opportunity will be required to register with (free of charge) and apply through Hampshire County Council’s online tendering portal https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire. Tender reference is Public Health & Clinical Commissioning Group Integrated Level 3 Sexual Health Services(CO05782 ). Locate the tender(s) and “express an interest”. Full and complete procurement documentation is available when you have attached/”expressed an interest’’ to the tender/project. We recommend that you refer to the e-tendering guidance for suppliers which can be found by clicking on 'Information for Suppliers' at the top of the home page.

Title: Special Educational Needs and Disability Information, Advice and Support Service (SENDIASS) - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council wishes to commission one Service Provider to deliver a Special Educational Needs and Disability Information, Advice and Support Service for Hampshire. The aim of the Service is to assist the Council in delivering its specific duty to provide information, advice and a support service to children, their parents and carers and young people with SEND, as defined in Parts 19 and 32 of the Children and Families Act 2014. The Council has worked with the Hampshire NHS Clinical Commissioning Groups (CCGs) for the purpose of defining the Service.
      
      The scope of this information, advice and support should cover initial concerns or identification of potential SEN or disabilities, through to ongoing support and provision, which may include an Education, Health and Care plan. The specification incorporates legislative requirements whilst also addressing the requirements of parents and professionals.
      
      The contract will commence on 1 January 2019 and will be for a period of three years with the option to extend for one further two year period. 
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 3 p.m. on 20 September 2018.
      
      This tender is being conducted using a bespoke process under the Light Touch Regime, which will include a selection, Invitation to Tender (ITT) and, if required, due diligence stage. Details of the process can be found in the procurement documentation.
      
      Invitation to tender documentation will be made available and should subsequently be submitted via Hampshire County Council's Electronic Tendering tool (In-Tend website: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire). Organisations can obtain guidance on how to use this tool by accessing the website and clicking on the button titled "Information for Suppliers".

Title: Local Healthwatch for Hampshire - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council is seeking a suitably qualified and experienced service provider to deliver Local Healthwatch for the Hampshire County Council area. 
      
      Local Healthwatch is the independent champion for people who use health and social care services.  It exists to make sure that those running services, and the government, put people at the heart of care. Local Healthwatch is unique in that its main purpose is to understand the needs, experiences and concerns of people who use health and social care services and to speak out on their behalf.  
      
      Local Healthwatch for Hampshire has two key service elements: Public and Patient Involvement and Information, Signposting and Advice services.  
      
      The contract commences on 1st April 2018 and is for an initial period of 3 years with two additional 12 month extension periods.
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return documents together with any supporting information requested by 14.00 hrs on Tuesday 12th December 2017.

Title: Frankie Workers 2020 - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations to deliver Frankie Workers services. Frankie Workers will provide therapeutic counselling to children and young people aged 0 - 18 years who are victims of sexual abuse, sexual exploitation or female genital mutilation. The aim is to prevent trauma turning into poor mental health. 
      
      The Service started in the Hampshire County Council area in June 2017. The Service was also commissioned for the Portsmouth City Council and Isle of Wight Council areas. The Hampshire service operates across the County area. 
      
      The Contract will be for a duration eleven months, 1 May 2020 to 31 March 2021, with the option to extend for a further period of up to two years until 31 March 2023, depending on availability of funding, future commissioning strategy of sexual crime support services, and Contract review.   
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 14:00 hrs on 13 February 2020. 
        
      How to obtain the Tender Documents   
      The Tender documents can be accessed when logged into In-Tend by selecting 'View Details' on the relevant tender advert and clicking the 'Express Interest' tab. Once in the tender there are five tabs: Select the 2nd tab where you will find useful information under 'Tender Details' continue to scroll down to the heading 'Tender Documents Received' where you will be able to view / download the documents.   
        
      Opting In and Out   
      Please note that you are required to 'Opt In' before you can access the 'My tender Return' to start populating your response.   
        
      The 'Opt Out' functionality will also be available throughout the duration of the tender process. Opting out will give you the option of declaring you no longer want to receive any further communication in relation to this tender along with the opportunity of providing comments and feedback for this decision.   
      You can choose to 'Opt In' at any time during the tender process if you initially decided to 'Opt Out'.   
        
      Please note you are required to 'Opt In' to view and complete the Questionnaire for this project.   
        
      Further Guidance   
      In addition, guidance on how to participate in a tender - download and upload documents / returns and if required, register your company (free of charge), can be found on the In-tend site under the 'Help' or 'Information for Suppliers' buttons.   
        
      Receiving Notification Emails   
      To ensure you receive email alerts and notifications from our system, please add the email domain `@in-tend.co.uk` to your Safe Senders list.

Title: AS10880 HAMPSHIRE RAPE AND SEXUAL ASSAULT TELEPHONE AND COUNSELLING SUPPORT SERVICE - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for Hampshire Rape & Sexual Assault Telephone & Counselling Support Services. 
      
      The Contract will commence on 1st April 2019 and will be for a period of two years.
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 14.00 hrs on Wednesday 12th September 2018.  
      
      The specification details a two year developmental service which will provide an evidence base from which a future service can be derived providing equitable support across the county and timely counselling provision to vulnerable individuals. The service will operate across four geographical 'Lot' areas (see Appendix 2 for a map of the lot areas).
      
      The service specification is in two parts. Both parts are required to be delivered.
      
      • Part 1 - Telephone helpline, face to face counselling services and support activities and groups for women and men, aged 18 years and above, who have experienced rape or sexual abuse/violence at any time in their lives. 
      • Part 2 - 6-8 sessions of counselling for people of any age who have experienced rape or sexual assault/abuse at any time in their lives and who have accessed or been referred from the Sexual Assault Referral Centre (SARC), Paediatric Sexual Assault Services (Paediatric SAS) to include those who have had contact with Specially Trained Police Officers (STO) (or equivalent) or Independent Sexual Violence Advisors (ISVA)
      The service will deliver a telephone helpline for people who have experienced rape, sexual assault, abuse or violence at any point in their lives. Telephone support may also be used to support people assessed and on the waiting list for face to face counselling. This will be provided pan-Hampshire in partnership across the four geographical lots, ideally utilising one phone number, in order to maintain an equitable service to all residents of the County.
      
      The service will offer support to non-abusing family of people who have experienced rape, sexual assault, abuse or violence through the telephone helpline.
      
      The service will deliver face to face counselling according to need, for people who have experienced rape, sexual assault, abuse or violence at any point in their lives.
      
      The service will work in partnership with other lot providers to share best practice around the recruitment and retention of counsellors, and benchmarking of data such as waiting times, referral types, group work, etc.
      The service will support people assessed and on the waiting list for face to face counselling in appropriate ways e.g. pre-counselling group work, regular contact to improve welfare and wellbeing.

Title: Furniture Reuse Development Service - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council is seeking an organisation(s) to deliver a holistic and joined up service, that can realise the social and economic value of furniture and household items through social enterprise and reuse. 
      
      The purpose of the service is to futureproof the provision of furniture to vulnerable groups and low income households as part of Hampshire's local welfare offer.   
      
      Working with existing local reuse organisations and social welfare providers across Hampshire will be integral to the new service.
      
      This innovative new service will enhance and support the County wide co-ordination of the provision of affordable furniture and other suitable household items through reuse and repair to ensure demand and supply needs are met across Hampshire's diverse local communities.   It will also assist reuse organisations to increase their turnover by opening up new referral routes, forging new partnerships and maximise opportunities to source new stock which will support business development.
      
      The Council proposes to enter into a contract with a term of two years. The project is fully funded and the contract value over the two year period will be £150,000.  The anticipated contract commencement date will be 1st March 2018.  
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 14.00 hrs on Friday 27th October 2017.

Title: Public Health Nursing 0-5 Years (Health Visiting And Family Partnership)
Description:
Hampshire County Council invites capable providers to tender for the provision of Public Health Nursing 0-5 years (Health Visiting and Family Nurse Partnership)

The Health Visiting service leads delivery of the Healthy Child Programme 0-5 years (HCP 0-5). The HCP 0-5 is an evidence based prevention and early intervention public health programme offered to all families resident in Hampshire and lies at the heart of the universal service for children and families. It aims to support parents, promote child development, reduce inequalities and contribute to improved child health outcomes and health and wellbeing.

The Family Nurse Partnership is a licensed, evidence based, intensive nurse-led prevention and early intervention programme for vulnerable first time young parents and their children.

All associated tender documentation is available now and all organisations interested in being considered for this opportunity will be required to register with (free of charge) and apply through Hampshire County Council’s online tendering portal https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire.
 
The deadline to submit your application is 31st August 2016. 

A Provider Briefing Event will be held, date to be confirmed.  

Anticipated initial contract duration will be 1st April 2017 to 31st July 2018 with options to extend for a period or periods not exceeding two years offering a potential total contract term of 40 months. 

Anticipated contract value over the potential maximum contract term is £55,220,333.

TUPE may apply 
 
For further information and full guidance please visit https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire. Tender references are CO07866 Public Health Nursing 0-5 years (Health Visiting and Family Nurse Partnership). Locate the tender(s) and “express an interest”. Full and complete procurement documentation is available when you have ”expressed an interest’’ to the tender. We recommend that you refer to the e-tendering guidance for providers which can be found by clicking on 'Information for Suppliers' at the top of the home page.
Contact Address 1: Hampshire County Council, Elizabeth II Court

Title: SBS Mens Engagement Training - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for SBS Project Men's Engagement Training. 
      
      Hampshire County Council (The Council) is part of an EU-funded project called Step by Step (SBS). The aim of the project is to improve men's health and wellbeing and is focused on developing a new model of community health and wellbeing.  The Council is seeking a Provider to deliver Men's Engagement training, involved in the SBS project.
        
      The provider will develop a Men's Engagement training package and supporting Digital Marketing Toolkit in line with the Specification.
      
      The focus of men's engagement training will be on developing knowledge, understanding and skills that attendees can then use to improve the marketing of their activities/services in order to increase engagement from men. There should be an emphasis on practical skills and ensuring attendees leave the training with confidence. Men's Marketing and Engagement Training will be based the following principles;
      o Bespoke to men, using language that engages men 
      o Evidence-based  
      o Focus on how skills can be used on a practical basis within a male-focused environment
      o Provide access to a range of resources that can be used to guide and support marketing activities within the attendees own group or organisation.
      
      Total contract value is up to ?15,000.
      
      The Contract will commence on 15th June 2019 and will be for a period of 1 year and 6 months.
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 12:00 hrs on Tuesday the 28th May 2019.

Title: SBS Health Champion Training - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for SBS Project Health Champion Training. 
      
      Hampshire County Council (The Council) is part of an EU-funded project called Step by Step (SBS). The aim of the project is to improve men's health and wellbeing and is focused on developing a new model of community health and wellbeing.  The Council is seeking a Provider to deliver Health Champion Training involved in the SBS project.
        
      The provider will develop a health champions training package and supporting training material e.g. presentations, handouts, in line with below. 
      
      The focus of Health Champion training will be on developing healthy conversation skills that men can use within their groups. There should be an emphasis on skills practice and ensuring men leave the training with confidence. Healthy conversations skills will be based the following principles;
      o Bespoke to men, using language that engages men in health and emotional wellbeing and mental health
      o Evidence-based and underpinned by theories of behaviour changes
      o Informed by Making Every Contact Count (MECC) and Five Ways to Wellbeing 
      o Cover health and emotional wellbeing and mental health, with a recognition that one influences the other
      o Focus on how skills can be used within a male-focused environment
      
      Total contract value is up to ?30,000.
      
      The Contract will commence on 15th June 2019 and will be for a period of 1 year and 6 months.
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 12:00 hrs on Tuesday the 28th May 2019.

Title: Smoking and Substance Misuse Prevention -  a whole organisation approach  - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to tender for a service to deliver smoking, alcohol and substance use guidance and awareness training to teaching staff to enable them to deliver appropriate smoking alcohol and substance use training to young people as part of a whole school/ whole organisation approach.  
      
      The Services being tendered comprise two Lots
      Lot 1 - services relating to prevention of smoking with young people
      Lot 2 - services relating to alcohol and drug use  
      
      Tenderers may choose to tender for: Lot 1 and Lot 2 or, for Lot 1 only or, for Lot 2 only
      
      The Services are each part of a wider Health in Educational Settings Project that supports the Council's Public Health Strategy Towards a Healthier Hampshire - A Strategy for Improving the Public Health 2016-21 vision, "Healthy, happy and resilient communities now and for the future generations in Hampshire".
      
      The provision of the Services will also support schools to deliver relationship and sex education (RSE) and personal, social, health and economic education (PSHE) including the statutory content of Relationship Education, Relationship and Sex Education and Health Education (to be implemented 2020). 
      
      Lot 1 is to provide guidance and to deliver tailored training for staff in educational settings on smoking and vaping. This will increase the capacity of such staff to adopt a whole school or whole organisation approach to smoking and vaping and to deliver age appropriate smoking and vaping education to young people.
       
      Lot 2 is to deliver tailored alcohol and drug misuse awareness training to staff in educational settings. This will increase the capacity of such staff to adopt a whole school or whole organisation approach to alcohol and drug use and to deliver age appropriate alcohol and drug use education to young people
      
      The Contract will commence on 1st February 2020.
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 11.00 hours Tuesday 7th January 2020.

Description:
Hampshire County Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for the Provision of Catering Services to Gosport Discovery Centre
      
      The purpose of this Invitation to Tender (ITT) is to establish a Contract whereby the Provision of Catering Services to Gosport Discovery Centre will take place. The Council's intention is to award this contract to one primary contractor, to deliver all service requirements as per the specification. 
      The estimated Contract commencement date is the 1st November 2018. The Contract will be let for an initial term of 3 years with an option to extend on an annual basis to a total maximum term of 5 years.

Title: Public Health Provision of NHS Health Checks Pilot Programme
Description:
Hampshire County Council is undertaking a pilot to inform the design of the future NHS Health Check programme across Hampshire from April 2019. Participating practices will be opted out of the current health checks system.

Primary Care Practice Groups/Alliances will need to have a population of around 17,000 40-74 year olds to achieve a monthly invite rate of around 200 eligible people (approximate list size of 40,000).

Financial and technical support will be provided in the period up to the pilot start date and will continue throughout the pilot duration. A tiered payment structure, based on evidence of the outputs from the health check, will be implemented during the pilot phase. The pilot will be carefully evaluated to aid development of the future Hampshire NHS Health Check programme due to commence from April 2019.

This is a real opportunity for local Primary Care providers to help shape the future delivery of NHS Health Checks in Hampshire and improve outcomes for practice populations.

Title: Real Time Passenger Information (RTPI) - Supply, Installation & Maintenance - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for the provision of Real Time Passenger Information (RTPI) systems across Hampshire. 
      
      This Framework Agreement will be for installation and commissioning including optional maintenance of 'at stop electronic display screens' that will be linked to existing Real Time Passenger Information (RTPI) systems across Hampshire. The screens will be directly linked to bus operator tracking systems and central systems to calculate and relay bus arrival times to the electronic displays.
      
      The Framework will commence on 18th August 2017 and will be for a period of four years.
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 14:00 hrs on Tuesday 30th May 2017 .  
      
      How to obtain the Tender Documents
      The Tender documents can be accessed when logged into In-Tend by selecting 'View Details' on the relevant tender advert and clicking the 'Express Interest' tab. Once in the tender there are five tabs - 'Tender', 'ITT - documents', 'Correspondence', 'Clarifications' and 'History'. Select the 2nd tab (ITT - documents) where you will find useful information under 'Tender Details' continue to scroll down to the heading 'Tender Documents Received' where you will be able to view / download the documents.
      
      Opting In and Out
      Please note you are required to 'Opt In' before you can access the 'My tender Return' to start populating your response. 
      
      The 'Opt Out' functionality will also be available throughout the duration of the tender process. Opting out will give you the option of declaring you no longer want to receive any further communication in relation to this tender along with the opportunity of providing comments and feedback for this decision.
      You can choose to 'Opt In' at any time during the tender process if you initially decided to 'Opt Out'.
      
      Please note you are required to 'Opt In' to view and complete the Questionnaire for this project. 
      
      Further Guidance

Title: Hampshire Highways Service Contract (HHSC) - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council (HCC) invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for the Hampshire Highways Service Contract 2017- 2029. The purpose of this Tender is to secure a partner to provide highway maintenance services including contracting expertise and other services for the maintenance and improvement of the HCC highway network. 
      
      Whilst the upper estimated threshold for the contract will be £1.5 billion it is envisaged that the annual throughput will be in the region of £30 million.
      
      The term of the HHSC will be for an initial period from 1st August 2017 until 30th April 2024 with possible additional service periods of up to five years available. The additional service periods may be awarded by the Authority, subject to the successful and continuing performance measures identified in the contract documents and through discussion and partnership working with HCC.

Title: Bikeability level 2 & 3 cycle training for children and other cycle training based activities across the county - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for the provision of Bikeability - Cycle Training for Children.

Bikeability is the Cycling Proficiency Test for the 21st century, designed to give the next generation the skills and confidence to ride their bikes on today's roads. Whilst Bikeability is not part of the National Curriculum, under the Government's 'Travelling to school' action plan, teachers are encouraged to use Geography, Personal, Social, Health & Economic (PSHE),  Citizenship, Physical Education (PE) and other lessons to explain the benefits of sustainable travel, which includes cycling.

The training is delivered via schools during the school day to years 5-9 and available to all schools. There is also the opportunity of holiday courses where there is demand.

Level 2 Bikeability takes place on local streets, giving students a real cycling experience. They will be taught how to deal with traffic on short journeys such as cycling to school or the local shops. 

Level 3 Bikeability deals with more challenging roads and traffic situations. Level 3 training is delivered one-to-one or in groups of up to 3 so can be tailored to individual training needs, such as routes to school.  

The contract will procure the services of an external company who will provide qualified National Standard instructors to deliver the training. For Bikeability Level 2 and 3 training the company will be responsible for contacting schools to book courses, instructor scheduling, training area risk assessments and training in line with Bikeability national guidelines.

The contract will commence on 1st August 2016 and will be for a period of two years with the option to extend for a further two years.

Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document(s) together with any supporting information requested by 14.00hrs on Thursday 11th February 2016.

Title: 16+ High Intensity and Floating Support - geographical lots New Forest and Havant, Fareham, Gosport  - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations to deliver a high-quality supported accommodation service; providing person-centred and outcome focussed support to young people aged predominantly 16 to 18 for whom the Council has a duty to offer accommodation and who have been assessed as requiring high intensity or floating support. 
      
      The tender is for two geographical areas: New Forest and Havant, Fareham, Gosport. There will be a contract for each geographical area. A Tenderer can apply for one or both geographical areas. The High Intensity Service will be delivered in appropriate accommodation such as a shared house. The Floating Support will be delivered as support hours.
      
      The Contracts will commence on 1 November 2020 and will be for a period of 2 years and 8 months with the option to extend for a further 2 years.

Title: SBS Leader Development Programme - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council (The Council) is part of an EU-funded project called Step by Step (SBS). The aim of the project is to improve men's health and well being and is focused on developing a new model of community health and well being focused on community based groups. The Council is seeking a Provider to deliver an individualized, bespoke Leader Development Programmee to individuals involved in the SBS project.
        
      The SBS Leader Development Programme is tailored to the needs of SBS groups and consists of: 
      •One to One support provided to SBS Group Leaders to enable them to successfully set up, run their groups and implement the SBS model. Where appropriate this includes signposting to training provided by the SBS project and other external organisations.  
      •Provision of small grants programme to assist with group start-up and implementation of the SBS model 
      
      The Contract) will commence on 02 September 2019 and will be for a period of 1 year and 3 months.

Title: Hamble School Leisure Complex - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for the management and operation of the Hamble School leisure complex. 
      
      The Contract will commence on 1st June 2018 and will be for a period of ten years with the option to extend for a further five years.
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 14.00 hrs on Thursday 14th December 2017.  
      
      How to obtain the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire Documents
      
      The Pre-Qualification Questionnaire (PQQ) can be accessed when logged into In-Tend by selecting 'View Details' on the relevant tender advert and clicking the 'Express Interest' tab. Once in the tender there are five tabs - 'Tender', 'PQQ - documents', 'Correspondence', 'Clarifications' and 'History'. Select the 2nd tab (PQQ - documents) where you will find useful information under 'Tender Details' continue to scroll down to the heading 'Tender Documents Received' where you will be able to view / download the documents.
      
      Please download all the documents and read very carefully.
      
      Opting In and Opting Out
      Please note you are required to 'Opt In' before you can access the 'My tender Return' to start populating your response. 
      
      The 'Opt Out' functionality will also be available throughout the duration of the tender process. Opting out will give you the option of declaring you no longer want to receive any further communication in relation to this tender along with the opportunity of providing comments and feedback for this decision.
      
      You can choose to 'Opt In' at any time during the tender process if you initially decided to 'Opt Out'.
      
      Further Guidance
      In addition, guidance on how to participate in a tender - download & upload documents / returns and if required, register your company (free of charge), can be found on the In-tend site under the 'Help' or 'Information for Suppliers' buttons.
      
      Receiving Notification Emails
      To ensure you receive email alerts and notifications from our system, please add the email domain `@in-tend.co.uk` to your Safe Senders list. 
      
      Yours faithfully 
      Rob Walker

Title: Vehicle Spares and Consumables Framework - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for the supply of Vehicle Spares and Consumables. 
      
      The Framework will commence on 1st April 2018 and will be for a period of Two years, with the option to extend for a further Two years.
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 14.00 hrs on Monday 4th December 2017
      
      How to obtain the Tender Documents
      The Tender documents can be accessed when logged into In-Tend by selecting 'View Details' on the relevant tender advert and clicking the 'Express Interest' tab. Once in the tender there are five tabs - 'Tender', 'ITT - documents', 'Correspondence', 'Clarifications' and 'History'. Select the 2nd tab (ITT - documents) where you will find useful information under 'Tender Details' continue to scroll down to the heading 'Tender Documents Received' where you will be able to view / download the documents.
      
      Please download all the documents and read very carefully.
      
      Opting In and Opting Out
      Please note you are required to 'Opt In' before you can access the 'My tender Return' to start populating your response. 
      
      PLEASE NOTE you are required to 'Opt In' to view & complete the Questionnaire(s) for this project. 
      
      The 'Opt Out' functionality will also be available throughout the duration of the tender process. Opting out will give you the option of declaring you no longer want to receive any further communication in relation to this tender along with the opportunity of providing comments and feedback for this decision.
      
      You can choose to 'Opt In' at any time during the tender process if you initially decided to 'Opt Out'.
      
      Further Guidance
      In addition, guidance on how to participate in a tender - download and upload documents / returns and if required, register your company (free of charge), can be found on the In-tend site under the 'Help' or 'Information for Suppliers' buttons.
      
      Receiving Notification Emails
      To ensure you receive email alerts and notifications from our system, please add the email domain `@in-tend.co.uk` to your Safe Senders list.

Description:
Hampshire County Council invited applications from suitably experienced organisations who wished to be considered for selection to tender for the Generation 3 Technical Resources Framework (Gen3 TRF) 2016 - 2020.

The purpose of this Tender was to procure a framework of Suppliers to provide specialist technical temporary resources in the fields of highways engineering, property services including building surveyors, climate change and energy including ecologists and environmental engineers, waste management, landscaping and heritage, lighting engineers, planning and transportation, CAD technicians, public relations consultants for engineering communications and marketing and the like.

The Framework will commence on 1 April 2016 and will be for a period of 48 months.

Title: Advocacy Service - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council has a legal responsibilty to arrange advocacy for eligible people under the MHA, the MCA, the Care Act and the Children Act. Most Advocacy is issue based and relatively short term in nature, with the exception of some learning disability advocacy, which supports people to be involved and represents others in groups and on boards, and the Paid Representative service for people who lack capacity and who have no friends or family.

The Contract will commence on 1 April 2016 and will last for an initial period of 2 years with the option to extend, at the Council’s sole discretion, for a period of up to 1 year and then a further period of up to 1 year giving a maximum contract length of 4 years.

Organisations interested in being considered for this opportunity must complete and return the documentation through the Council’s online tendering system InTend. 

The closing date for submissions is strictly 2:00pm on 12 November 2015.

Notice Identifier: AS10235 Hampshire Prader-Willi & Specialist Learning Disability Support
Title: AS10235 Hampshire Prader-Willi & Specialist Learning Disability Support
Description:
This notice of contract opportunity is for the purpose of transparency and applies to the procurement of a contract for social care provision (within a supported living environment) to people with Prader-Willi syndrome and complex learning disabilities - as tendered through the procurement exercise AS10235 Hampshire Prader-Willi & Specialist Learning Disability Support. The service will be located in Winchester in central Hampshire and have a contracted capacity of 8 units.The service will support individuals in the management of their weight, nutritional and dietary requirements, as well as with the physical health conditions, learning disabilities and behavioural support requirements associated with Prader-Willi Syndrome. 
Most, if not all, service users are expected to be individuals with Prader-Willi Syndrome. It is possible that the service will also support individuals who do not have Prader-Willi Syndrome but who do have complex learning disabilities.  The service aims to enable individuals who have moved out of Hampshire to return to the County to live nearer their families. The service also aims to prevent reliance on individuals having to access out of county placements in the future.Traditionally people with Prader-Willi Syndrome have had their needs met in residential care accommodation. This new service will offer care and support to people in a supported living setting, where individuals will hold their own tenancies. 
The project will involve working effectively with individuals, their families and current providers to enable individuals to transition into the scheme, as well as developing and maintaining other partnerships with relevant agencies and community resources as required. There will be a strong emphasis in the service of recognising individuals' strengths, promoting independence, healthy lifestyles, active citizenship, community presence, and positive risk taking. 
It is anticipated that the scheme will open during October 2017 and be operating at full, or near to full, capacity by the end of January 2018. The initial contract term is for a maximum of 3 years with an option to extend for up to a further 4 years through two-yearly contract extensions (2+2). The maximum annual budget available for the service will be up to £518,460 per annum.

Organisations interested in being considered for this opportunity will be required to register with and apply through Hampshire County Council's online tendering opportunities portal: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire/ 

. Expressions of interest for AS10235 Hampshire Prader-Willi & Specialist Learning Disability Support Service must be made using In-Tend from Friday 26th May 2017 with a deadline for submissions of 2.00pm, Friday 30th June 2017
Parent Reference: AS10235 Hampshire Prader-Willi & Specialist Learning Disability Support

Notice Identifier: Hampshire Carers Support & Dementia Advisors Service - LOT 2 (West Hampshire)
Title: Hampshire Carers Support & Dementia Advisors Service - LOT 2 (West Hampshire)
Description:
This contract award notice is for the purpose of transparency only. The services have been procured through a one stage open procurement process. The services support carers and people living with dementia who live within the geographic jurisdiction of Hampshire County Council, the service provision being known as the Hampshire Carers Support & Dementia Advisors Service. Four single-contract lots of service provision were procured. This contract award notice relates to lot 2 (West Hampshire). The contract term will be for three years, with an option at the discretion of the Council to extend for a further period or periods not exceeding two years. The funding provided to the lot 2 contract by Hampshire County Council will be a fixed figure of £380,256 per annum. The total maximum contract value over the contract term (and including any periods of contract extension) will equate to £1,901,280.
The Council may exercise an option to purchase additional related services, including, but not limited to, the provision of services providing information, advice and support to carers in the context of hospital discharge up to the value of £300,000 and also for increased training delivery up to the value of £50,000 in any one year

Title: Provision of NHS Independent Health Complaints Advocacy Service - AWARD
Description:
The Council is seeking a suitably qualified and experienced provider to deliver an NHS Independent Health Complaints Advocacy Service for the Hampshire County Council area.  The procurement is for an initial 18 month contract period with the aim that the contract ends in line with other Advocacy Services contracts, in order to facilitate the opportunity to procure a single Advocacy Services contract for the Hampshire County Council area.  
      
      This procurement will be undertaken using our e-tendering system (In-tend) which can be found at: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire. 
      
      Tenderers are required to register their company details on In-tend. No charge is made for registration or access to this system. Full details and user guides on how to register and operate the system are available via the link https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire/ under the HELP tab.
      
      If you are not currently a registered supplier please register your company via the Company Details Tab at the top of the screen. Please note the email address used when registering as a new supplier should be for the person who will deal with the tender, as login details, subsequent messages and tender documents will be automatically sent to this email address. Please ensure the email account registered on this system is regularly monitored. You may register more than one user per organisation against your account. 
      
      Once you have registered, or if you already are a registered supplier, please Log On. Once in the website, click on Tenders on the top bar, scroll down to Current and then search for the title of this project for further information. If you wish to express interest please click on Express Interest. Tender documents will then be available for download.
      
      How to submit a tender using the In-tend web site:

Description:
Diver Inspection and Maintenance of Bridges within Hampshire that require two man, three man diver team (Confined Space) and three / four man diver team (Boat / Diving) team operations.

Three man diver team (Confined space), four man diver team (Full BA Diving/Confined space) and three/four man diver team (Boat /Diving) Team.

Hampshire County Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection for the Diver Inspection and Maintenance of Bridges tender on behalf of Hampshire County Council, the issuing Authority. The applicant shall have the capability and experience to carry out subsequent maintenance works as deemed necessary by the Council subject to agreed costs. Additional works value of approximately £75,000.00 per year is anticipated but not guaranteed and will typically involve concrete or brickwork repairs, pointing and scour protection works.

The Contract will commence on 1 May 2016 and will be for a period of 4 years with the option to extend for a further 2 years.

Title: Prevention & Enablement Service for Vulnerable Adults (PESVA): Lot 3 North Hants
Description:
The Prevention and Enablement Service for Vulnerable Adults, known and referred to as PESVA throughout this document, is a community based service offering a range of interventions including time limited direct support ( up to a maximum of 26 weeks) specifically for younger adults who just fall short of Adult Services Eligibility Criteria, as defined below. The service aims to maximise the long term independence of service users. The service will be delivered in the community and referrals into the service may come from Community Independence Teams, Learning Disability Teams or other representatives of  Hampshire County Council Adult Services department, in relation to drop in and telephone support, via self-referral from service users or advocacy services.

Types of service provision will include, but not limited to:

•	Telephone support 
•	Localised drop-in services 
•	Direct support for specific tasks achievable within a 26 week period

For the purpose of this service, the term ‘Just falls short of Adult Services eligibility criteria’ is defined as: Where an individual is likely to become eligible for a care package within 3- 6 months without intervention, or where an individual experiences a significant event which will, in all probability, result in high use of social care or health services without an intervention.

PESVA will also seek to ensure that people remain active participants in their communities and actively contribute to decisions regarding their support needs.  

PESVA will improve the individual’s quality of life, maximise their long term independence and enable them to remain within their community.  It will focus on supporting people so they can achieve their optimum level of independence with the lowest appropriate level of sustainable support.  

A key aspect of this is approach will be for the service provider to make every effort to work in partnership with a range of statutory, voluntary and community led services to achieve the individual’s identified outcomes.  This may include establishing links with local Citizen’s Advice Bureaux, Wellbeing Centres, Job Centres, Hampshire Autism Support Service and other agencies as required.


The service will be divided into three lots and there will be one provider per lot. The lots will mirror the structure of the current Adult Services Learning Disability Directorate Localities (See map):

South East Hampshire (covering Fareham and Gosport, Havant and East Hampshire)
West Hampshire (covering Eastleigh, New Forest and Test Valley)
North Hampshire (covering Winchester, Basingstoke, Deane and Hart and Rushmoor)

Title: Help to Live at Home Open Framework
Description:
Open Opportunity - this is an Open Framework meaning that you can apply to join at any time until the closing date of 19/07/2022.


The Help to Live at Home Open Framework has been developed by Hampshire County Council (The Council),in conjunction with The Council's partners (the 5 Hampshire Clinical Commissioning Groups (CCG's), current providers of Homecare services), to help meet the challenges of providing Adults' home-care services over the next 5-7 years. It is an opportunity for providers to work with The Council and CCG's to develop these services in Hampshire moving forward.

The Open framework has been set up to be used for personal care and support services by both the Council and the CCG's. The services under the Open Framework cover the Council's domiciliary care requirements(including the replacement of the Care at Home service), reablement services (currently contracted as REACT),the care element of extra care and the CCGs Continuing Healthcare requirements. This is not a comprehensive list and the Open Framework will be flexible to capture emerging requirements throughout it's lifetime.

The first stage for Providers interested in delivering work through this Open Framework is to register with In-Tend and then complete an enrolment questionnaire. The enrolment questionnaire will require providers to submit details relating to their organisation which will be assessed by the Council and successful providers will be admitted onto the Open Framework. The Open framework will always be open meaning that providers can apply at any time and providers who have previously been unsuccessful may re-apply once they have taken any corrective action.

Being accepted onto the Open Framework is no guarantee of work, but will allow providers to view and tender for Call-Off contracts for both The Council and the CCG's.

In order to view the enrolment documentation, please go to the procurement portal:
https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire/aspx/

All providers already accepted can be found at 
https://www.hants.gov.uk/business/procurement/contract-award-notices/AS08860-help-to-live-at-home
Contact Name: Adults' Health and Care Procurement team

Title: Hampshire Disabilities Day Opportunity Model (HDDOM) update
Description:
Open Opportunity - this is an Open Framework meaning that you can apply to join at any time until the closing date of 31/08/2028.

**Please note the close date states 01/08/2016, however this opportunity is still open until 31/08/2028**

Hampshire County Council intends to commission day opportunities for individuals (of sixteen years of age or older) with Learning Disabilities, Autism Spectrum Conditions, Physical Disabilities, Sensory Impairments, Mental Health Problems and other Vulnerable Adults that are based on the principles of enablement. The Council will achieve this through contractual arrangements with service providers that are based on an outcomes-focused, personalised approach.

Increasingly, people who receive social care funding wish to take up mainstream social and cultural opportunities. They want to receive support and partake in activities that are personalised and allow them to build broader social networks. Traditional day services have sometimes been less effective in enabling these sorts of opportunities. 

Day opportunity services will provide meaningful activities to service users and will support them to participate in a range of occupational, vocational and leisure activities, all designed to promote greater independence. Services will also support carers, where appropriate, by providing respite and allowing them to take a significant break from their caring responsibilities. 

Services may be delivered at a fixed location or from a location in the community; the latter may be any ordinary facility in the community that is suitable for people with disabilities and, in particular, for the needs of the individuals attending the group. Although the aims of both models of services will remain the same, the delivery method will vary according to the needs of individuals and their identified personal outcomes. 

All services will be enabling in nature and aim to build confidence and skills. The service provider will work pro-actively to incorporate an outcome-focused approach to the delivery of services. The service provider will develop systems that demonstrate outcomes to service users, commissioners and other stakeholders.

Day opportunity services may not necessarily require a dedicated building or centre. It is the function of the service in maintaining and extending social networks and access to mainstream activities that is critical.

The service may be provided and charged for in full or half day sessions, although more flexible approaches may be agreed through negotiation. Transport will be assessed separately and will be based on individual need. 

Hampshire County Council will work collaboratively with providers to further develop the day opportunities over the life of the contract. Service providers will accept and acknowledge that aspects of this specification may change as innovative models of service provision are developed and access to mainstream community facilities improves.

Title: Supply and Installation of Camping Pods at Runways End Outdoor Centre... - AWARD
Description:
Supply and Installation of Camping Pods at Runways End Outdoor Centre
      
      Hampshire County Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for the supply of Supply and Installation of Camping Pods at Runways End Outdoor Centre
      
      The general scope and requirement of the contract will be to supply and install 10 insulated framed structured camping pods  which will provide accommodation for short term breaks in a campsite environment at Runways End Outdoor Centre, Aldershot, Hampshire, GU11 2RE.
      
      The contract will include the supply and installation of 10 insulated framed structured camping pods equipped with under floor or alternative heating facility. The total area involved will be approximately 1200m2 of the existing campsite. The Pod design is to be innovative, in keeping with the indicative design given planning approval. It must also be complimentary to and blend in with natural rural surrounding.
      Estimated budget is within the range £110K - £140K 
      
      Each unit is to provide suitable short term accommodation for four persons and consideration will be given to include provision for ambulant users and vision impaired users. Pod specification to include provision to meet appropriate Building Regulations Approved Document M - Access to and Use of Buildings - particularly for ambulant disabled persons, to at least one pod.
      
      The Contract will commence on 17th September 2018 and will be for a period of three months.
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 14.00 on Monday 13th August 2018.

      Hampshire County Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations to deliver a high-quality supported accommodation service; providing person-centred and outcome focussed support to young people aged predominantly 16 to 18 for whom the Council has a duty to offer accommodation and who have been assessed as requiring high intensity or floating support.

The High Intensity Service will be delivered in appropriate accommodation such as a shared house. The delivery of Floating Support will be as and when provision is requested and agreed. Title: Provision of Casualty Insurance - Excess Layer 1 (£25m over £50m)
Description:
Commercial Insurance Policy to increase Hampshire County Council's limits of liability over the primary insurance cover of £50million, required to provide appropriate indemnity for the County Council's risks.
This policy provides cover for Third Party Liability claims from members of the public, employees and pupils/service users.  This insurance is on a Combined Liability basis and consists of Public and Products Liability, Employers Liability and Pollution Liability and provides insurance against third party claims for injury, damage to property and financial loss arising from activities as a County Council.  This includes claims against the County Council arising from the use of the Highways.

Title: Open Framework For The Provision Of Public Health Services
Description:
The Open Framework For The Provision Of Public Health Services has been developed by Hampshire County Council to meet the demand of providing community based Public Health services over the next 5-7 years. It is an opportunity for providers to work with The Council to deliver these services in Hampshire moving forward.
The services under the Open Framework include Long Acting Reversible Contraception, Emergency Hormonal Contraception, NHS Health Checks, Seasonal Influenza Immunisation for eligible HCC staff. This is not a comprehensive list and the Open Framework will be flexible to capture emerging requirements throughout it's lifetime.

The Open Framework is conducted under the "light touch regime" Providers interested in delivering work through this Open Framework need to register with In-Tend and then complete an enrolment questionnaire. The enrolment questionnaire will require providers to submit details relating to their organisation which will be assessed by the Council and successful providers will be admitted onto the Open Framework. The Open Framework will always be open meaning that providers can apply at any time and providers who have previously been unsuccessful may re-apply once they have taken any corrective action.
Being accepted onto the Open Framework is no guarantee of work, and service users may engage the provider for the services via the Open Framework at any time. Providers will be engaged directly by the service users and will be chosen by service user choice.
Some of the services likely to be included in the Open Framework are detailed in the short description however the Open Framework will be flexible to accommodate emerging requirements. This is set out in the procurement documents.
Additional Text: There is no guarantee of work once  a provider has been awarded on to the framework. Each service is drop-in based and therefore the value received is dependent upon the amount of patients that are provided for.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [https://www.hants.gov.uk/socialcareandhealth/publichealth/contra|https://www.hants.gov.uk/socialcareandhealth/publichealth/contracts|NONE||Yes|Yes]

Title: AS11728 CYP (0-25) Outcomes Framework Consultancy
Description:
The procurement process was a competitive quotation (non-OJEU) through invitation to quote in accordance with the Council's Contract Standing Orders. This notice of contract award applies to the procurement of a contract for supply of an external consultancy service to Hampshire County Council to develop an Outcomes Framework for application across a range of health and social care service provision relating to children and young people aged 0-25 years old. This will articulate shared outcomes across the health and social care system locally, working to improve the health and well-being of Children & Young People in Hampshire, both through future commissioning and the following means:
Quality improvement: 
Shifting the emphasis towards realising meaningful outcomes from the services we commission using outcomes based commissioning (rather than demonstrating activity) in future service specification development.
Identifying and address areas of service delivery that require improvement through monitoring of Outcomes delivery.
Clarity and transparency:
Providing outcomes against which services can be monitored and evaluated, allowing direct comparisons and identification of best practice.
Financial responsibility:
Ensuring the best use of limited resources so that these are directed to interventions that will have the maximum impact on outcomes for children and young people.
Helping in the identification of where in the health and social care system efficiencies could be made.
Promoting integration across the sector
Supporting and encouraging stakeholders to work together to achieve common goals. 
Supporting the improvement of pathways to enable seamless high quality experiences for CYP and their families.

Title: Younger Adults Extra-care - LOT 2 (Basingstoke)
Description:
The services have been procured through a mini-competition procurement exercise, the services for Lot 2 (Basingstoke) tendered as a single contract lot, the contract being a call-off contract from a framework, specifically the Hampshire Framework for Shared Living and Learning Disability Support. For Lot 2 (Basingstoke) the initial contract term will be 3 years, with scope at the Council's discretion for 2 additional extension periods each of up to 2 years. Organisations were able to bid for as many of the 4 lots that were tendered as they wished, but could only be awarded a maximum of one contract. The Basingstoke specialist housing younger adults extra care scheme will be an accommodation based supported living scheme delivering a range of social care and support activities to people with learning disabilities and physical disabilities, health conditions and high levels of physical care needs. Those living at the scheme will be younger adults, ordinarily aged 18 and over, assessed as eligible for social care under the Care Act 2014, and who have an on-going need for the minimum level of support provided at the scheme. The accommodation is being built by Hampshire County Council (The Council) and consists of 2 semi-detached bungalows each with 3 bedrooms. The scheme will support service users to manage and maintain their tenancies and to access their local community and its resources. Service users will be supported to have as much choice and control of their lives as possible, and to maximise their skills within their capabilities. The core of the service delivery will be about positive risk taking, positive behaviour support and least restrictive practice. There will also be a focus on excellent support from staff and management of the scheme. The following is the expected range of support levels that will be required depending on the specific needs of the individuals who move in to the scheme:
Day time hours: Anticipated core hours: Between 210 - 315 hours each week. Additional 1:1 hours: Up to 315 hours each week.
Night support: Waking night: Up to 2 waking night staff each night. Sleep in support: Up to 1 sleep in staff each night.

Title: New Forest Launchpad Service
Description:
This Contract Award Notice is for the purpose of transparency only. This opportunity was open to those providers approved on the Hampshire Learning Disability Framework. 

The Launchpad service provides community based leisure, occupational and vocational activities to service users who may have previously attended Hampshire County Council operated day services in the area. Small groups of people (typically three or four people) are supported to participate in community based activities of their choosing.  The provider will support people to consider meaningful community based activities that enhance their skills and confidence and promote social inclusion.

The service provider will work pro-actively to incorporate an outcomes focused approach to the delivery of services, with a view to the groups requiring less support over time, thus freeing capacity for new referrals into the service.

Title: Bespoke Lock Gates for Basingstoke Canal - AWARD
Description:
The Basingstoke Canal Authority (BCA) (a local Authority partnership hosted by Hampshire County Council) (HCC) manages the Basingstoke Canal for HCC and Surrey County Council (SCC) – the owners of the waterway since 1976. 

All lock gates are bespoke, each lock chamber is unique and can vary considerably and is not necessarily symmetrical, or uniform in width, height or batter.  As part of the contract, it is the Supplier’s responsibility to visit each site and take full and sufficient measurements to enable them to fabricate the specified pair of gates to fit the chamber, forming a good seal with each other and the cill beam. 

The Framework is due to commence October 2016 and will be for a period of two years with the option to extend by a further two years in annual increments.

Title: Liss Generic
Description:
Liss Generic contract will initially provide up to 448 day time support hours and 63 waking night hours, plus one sleep in (total of 7 sleep in's per week). The support provider will work proactively with Hampshire County Council to review the operation of the service. The maximum number of hours delivered at the service will be 600 hundred hours per week, 63 waking night hours and one sleep in.

The Service will provide the following support to service users:
•	Individual support and domiciliary care
•	Shared support (including shared accommodation but not residential accommodation)
•	Overnight support to individuals and groups of individuals
•	Provision of Community Support Networks
•	Support to access employment, education and other vocational activities
•	Supported lodgings (where support, not including personal care, is provided by a landlord or their representative)
•	Individual services called off under the Framework will comprise one or more of these elements.

The Call Off Contract will commence on 27th April 2017 and will last for an initial period of 3 years with the option to extend, at the Council's sole discretion, for a period of up to 1 years 11 months and 5 days giving a maximum contract length of 4 years 11 months and 5 days.

Description:
The Domiciliary Care Rapid Discharge Service is a Covid-19 response short-term service put in place to support the timely discharge of service users who may have an eligible Care Act need or need support with discharge from a Hospital setting to their own home. The service will be used where a long-term package of care is likely to be needed. All service users discharged into this service will be followed up by a Hampshire County Council member of staff. 
 
Individuals discharged into this service may be Covid-19 positive and there is an expectation that the service provider will accept these individuals into this service.  The Service Provider is expected to manage this need appropriately and in line with NHSE guidelines.

Title: Launchpad Aldershot
Description:
This Contract Award Notice is for the purpose of transparency only.
This contract has been let for 2 years. There is an option to extend for a maximum further period of 2 years in total. 

The Launchpad service provides community based leisure, occupational and vocational activities to service users with Learning Disabilities who may have previously attended Hampshire County Council operated day services in the area. Small groups of people (typically three or four people) are supported to participate in community based activities of their choosing.  The provider will support people to consider meaningful, community based activities that enhance their skills and confidence and promote social inclusion. The service provider will work pro-actively to incorporate an outcomes focused approach to the delivery of services, with a view to the groups requiring less support over time, thus freeing capacity for new referrals into the service.
