Title: Syrian Vulnerable Persons Relocation Scheme
Description:
This contract Award Notice is for the purpose of transparency only.

To provide and co-ordinate integration support for Syrian Refugees relocating to the Hampshire County Council area under the Government’s Syrian Vulnerable Persons Relocation Scheme (VPR Scheme).

The VPR Scheme prioritises people requiring urgent medical treatment, survivors of torture and violence, and women and children at risk. All applicants (including accompanying family members) are subject to the usual immigration checks and screening prior to a visa being granted. Those with a criminal past or links to war crimes or extremism are excluded from the scheme.

This contract has been let on a 1+ 1 year basis. The total value of the contract will not exceed £100 000 over the lifetime of the contract (1+1).

Title: Hampshire Extra-care - LOT 5 (Test Valley)
Description: This notice of contract award is for the purpose of transparency only and applies to the award of a contract for extra-care service provision within the Test Valley district of Hampshire (i.e. this being LOT 5 of six LOTS of extra-care provision tendered through the procurement exercise AS08295 Hampshire Extra-care). The service will provide stability and consistent availability and quality of extra-care service provision, that ensures individuals’safety and protection from harm; and consistency in delivery of care and support at night–including unplanned care as necessary. The service will work effectively with those seeking to access extra-care, extra-care accommodation providers, the District Council  and County Council to facilitate effective and appropriate access arrangements. The service will generate increased opportunities for individuals to participate in social and communal activities within the schemes; promote individuals’ independence, health and wellbeing - including through complementing assistive technology solutions linked to individuals’ packages of care; and support implementation within schemes of a new “Waking Night and Wellbeing" funding model relating to waking night support, alarm response, and communal/social activity support. Service provision will included the regulated activity of delivery of "personal care that can be delivered in a persons home and/or Extra Care" in accordance with the Health and Social Care Act 2008 (Regulated Activities) Regulations 2014 within the extra-care schemes  Lion Oak Court and Warner Court, both of which are located in Andover in Hampshire. The schemes will have a contracted capacity of 91 units.

Title: Police Vehicle Salvage and Disposal 2016 - AWARD
Description:
The Police and Crime Commissioner for Hampshire invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for the disposal of Vehicles by scrapping, salvage or auction.

The Police and Crime Commissioner for Hampshire wishes to establish an Agreement for the scrapping, recycling or sale of seized, collision damaged and crime related vehicles, recovered in the two counties of Hampshire and the Isle of Wight.

The Contract will commence on 1 April 2016 and will be for a period of one year with the option to extend for a further year.

Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 14.00 hrs on Friday 19 February 2016.

How to obtain the Tender Documents
The Tender documents can be accessed when logged into In-Tend by selecting ‘View Details’ on the relevant tender advert and clicking the ‘Express Interest’ tab. Once in the tender there are five tabs – ‘Tender’, ‘ITT – documents’, ‘Correspondence’, ‘Clarifications’ and ‘History’. Select the 2nd tab (ITT - documents) where you will find useful information under ‘Tender Details’ continue to scroll down to the heading ‘Tender Documents Received’ where you will be able to view / download the documents.

Opting In and Out
Please note you are required to ‘Opt In’ before you can access the ‘My tender Return’ to start populating your response. 

The ‘Opt Out’ functionality will also be available throughout the duration of the tender process. Opting out will give you the option of declaring you no longer want to receive any further communication in relation to the this tender along with the opportunity of providing comments and feedback for this decision.
You can choose to ‘Opt In’ at any time during the tender process if you initially decided to ‘Opt Out’.

 Please note you are required to ‘Opt In’ to view and complete the Questionnaire for this project. 

Further Guidance
In addition, guidance on how to participate in a tender – download and upload documents / returns and if required, register your company (free of charge), can be found on the In-tend site under the ‘Help’ or ‘Information for Suppliers’ buttons.

Receiving Notification Emails
To ensure you receive email alerts and notifications from our system, please add the email domain `@in-tend.co.uk` to your Safe Senders list.

Title: Vehicle Accident Repair Services Framework - AWARD
Description:
Chief Constable of Hampshire Constabulary invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for the Supply of Accident and Repair Services for Vehicles.
      
      A multi-lot framework agreement to provide an effective procurement route for accident and repair services for Hampshire Constabulary, Hampshire Fire and Rescue Service and Hampshire Transport Management. The Framework will commence on 27th January 2020 and will be for a period of four years.
      
      The Chief Constable of Hampshire Constabulary is the lead authority for the set up of this framework.
      
      The overriding objectives of the framework agreement are:
      
      - to provide value for money,
      
      - to provide a consistent quality of service and workmanship,
      
      - to streamline the processes.
      
      The framework will be divided into the following lots by vehicle type and the repair required.
      Lot 1 - Repair of Cars and Light Commercial Vehicles
      Lot 2 - Repair of HGV Vehicles over 7,5 Tonne
      Lot 3 - Mobile Small to Medium area Repair Techniques (SMART)
      This framework will operate under differing requirements by lot.
      Potential suppliers will be allowed to bid for individual or all lots and will be awarded based on their capability
      
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 14.00 hrs on Thursday 28th November 2019.

Title: AS09292
Description:
The HDPR is a bespoke procurement vehicle under the light touch regime effectively operating as a hybrid between a traditional framework and dynamic purchasing system. A full description of the HDPR, how it operates, how to apply and how services will be called off is available in Document 4 of the procurement documentation.

The HDPR will remain open for applications for the duration of its lifespan (4+2 years). Application is by way of submitting a completed application form. There will be a temporary closure period between 5.9.2016 and 16.9.2016 for the development of the master timeline in conjunction with providers who have submitted applications prior to the closure period. During this time new applications will not be evaluated. The order of call-offs will be determined with reference to the master timeline.

The HDPR is open to all providers of residential care (excluding older persons residential care) operating in Hampshire and providing services to Hampshire service users.
Additional Text:
From April 2019 the authority will publish regular quarterly updates to the list of providers added to the HDPR via a public webpage, accessible via the following link: https://www.hants.gov.uk/business/procurement/contract-award-notices/AS09292-hampshire-de-registration-partnership.

The total value of £115,000,000 is the total estimated value awarded to providers over the lifetime of the contract.

Title: Fareham East Complex
Description:
This Mini Competition was open to those providers approved on the Hampshire Learning Disability Framework and who are signed up to provide in the Fareham area and accredited with the following Specialisms:

— Specialism 1 — High Level and Fluctuating Needs;
— Specialism 2 — Health-related Needs.
— Specialism 3 — Communication and Sensory Needs

Hampshire Fareham East Complex will deliver a range of care and support activities to people with learning disabilities, Autism Spectrum Conditions and other assessed social care needs across Hampshire.

The service will also support people with secondary needs for example learning disability, physical disability, substance use issues and autistic spectrum conditions. 
The supported housing service will encompass both Younger Adults Extra Care Housing (YAECH) and Stage 1 and 2 plus services across the whole site. The Office of the Police & Crime Commissioner (OPCC) for Hampshire invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to manage the Integrated Offender Management (IOM) - Commissioned Service for Substance misusing Service Users programme.

      How to obtain the Tender Documents
      The Tender documents can be accessed when logged into In-Tend by selecting 'View Details' on the relevant tender advert and clicking the 'Express Interest' tab. Once in the tender there are five tabs - 'Tender', 'ITT - documents', 'Correspondence', 'Clarifications' and 'History'. Select the 2nd tab (ITT - documents) where you will find useful information under 'Tender Details' continue to scroll down to the heading 'Tender Documents Received' where you will be able to view / download the documents.
      
      Opting In and Out
      Please note you are required to 'Opt In' before you can access the 'My tender Return' to start populating your response. 
      
      The 'Opt Out' functionality will also be available throughout the duration of the tender process. Opting out will give you the option of declaring you no longer want to receive any further communication in relation to this tender along with the opportunity of providing comments and feedback for this decision.
      You can choose to 'Opt In' at any time during the tender process if you initially decided to 'Opt Out'.
      
      Please note you are required to 'Opt In' to view and complete the Questionnaires
      
      Further Guidance
      In addition, guidance on how to participate in a tender - download and upload documents / returns and if required, register your company (free of charge), can be found on the In-tend site under the 'Help' or 'Information for Suppliers' buttons.
      
      Receiving Notification Emails
      To ensure you receive email alerts and notifications from our system, please add the email domain `@in-tend.co.uk` to your Safe Senders list.

Title: Orchard House
Description:
Orchard House is a 5- bedded bungalow which reflects a Core and Cluster Supported Living Scheme that has been specifically developed for adults with Autism and/or associated learning disabilities in Gosport.  Autism Hampshire are the support provider and Radian Housing Association will be the Registered Social Landlord who will issue the tenancies and manage the property. 

The Scheme will focus on enabling the individual tenants to develop the skills and confidence to live their lives as independently as possible.  Integral to the core support will be a requirement to develop tools to enable the effective monitoring of the attainment of service specific and individual outcomes.  

The aim of Orchard House is for the provider to develop and critically evaluate a range of monitoring tools and processes specifically designed for people with complex needs associated with Autism.  In order to do this effectively, the provider will need to meaningfully engage service users living in the scheme in the evaluation of progress against outcomes.  The active engagement of people with complex needs, including those with Autism and non-verbal communication, requires a skilled staff team and the ability to critically evaluate the effectiveness of a range of methods over an extended time period. 

It is an expectation that the provider will work to promote service user independence and reduce service user dependency on paid support (the support required beyond the core support hours) by taking a proactive approach to positive risk taking, applying the principles of active support and considering assistive technology options which maximise independence.

This contract has been let for 3 years with the option to extend for a period of +1+1.

Title: ASD00165.3.C.EEC Lane End House Emsworth Extra Care Scheme
Description:
This is a new service being developed in Emsworth in the South East corner of Hampshire on the border with West Sussex. The Scheme comprises of a large building, Lane End House, containing nine 1 bedroom flats, one 2 bedroom flat, one 3 bedroom flat and a separate on site 3 bedroom bungalow. The building also contains a communal area with kitchen, an office space and 2 sleep-in rooms, one of which is located in the bungalow and the other in the main building. The site is easily accessed by road, rail and bus and is close to Emsworth village centre which offers a range of shops and other amenities.
The scheme will ordinarily house up to 16 people who have a learning disability (the 2 bedroom flat being offered on the basis of one person, unless we have 2 people who want to share). There will be people with a range of needs occupying the service, including those with a physical disability; from those who are wheelchair users and require hoisting (accommodated in the bungalow), to some younger people with more challenging needs in some of the individual flats as well as some more independent people.
The initial phases of the project will involve working with individuals, their families and current providers to transition them into the scheme.
It is anticipated that the scheme will be operating at full, or near to full, capacity after several months. 
Once established there will be a strong emphasis in the service of promoting independence, citizenship, community presence and positive risk taking.
This is the first large scheme in Hampshire’s project to increase the amount of Extra Care available for adults with learning and physical disabilities.

Title: Mental Health Housing and Support Services - AWARD
Description: HCC are looking for suitable providers to deliver a new model of housing and support services to people with mental health problems in Hampshire. Services will be delivered across Hampshire but divided into 3 geographic lots. The full range of services, from crisis services (Stage 1), to wellbeing and recovery (Stage 2) and into community support will be included in each contract and providers will be expected to deliver and manage the whole housing and support pathway. Providers will be expected to be able to manage the accommodation based elements of the service, stage 1 and 2 as well as being able to deliver community support services in an innovative and localised way.

Title: COUNTYWIDE SERVICE TO PROVIDE CARE AND SUPPORT TO DEAF BRITISH SIGN LANGUAGE USERS

This Countywide service will provide care and support to deaf British sign language users and will provide staff trained to a minimum of BSL Level 2 or, where BSL is the service user’s first language, the member of staff will be able to demonstrate that they can sign at  level 2 or 3.  Staff will deliver person centred support work and/or personal care to people with an assessed social care need across Hampshire. The service will initially comprise of individuals known to Hampshire Adult Services, and will accept new referrals as required.

This contract will deliver up to 150 hours per week of day support hours to service users.

Title: Winchester City Council - Strategic Place-making Consultancy Services (SPC) - AWARD
Description:
Winchester City Council is looking to procure the services of a strategic place-making consultancy (SPC) to provide a multi disciplinary set of services to support with the implementation of its major projects and place strategy.
      
      Winchester City Council ("the Council") is looking to procure the services of a strategic place-making consultancy (SPC) to provide a multi disciplinary set of services to support with the implementation of its major projects and place strategy.
      
      Significant challenges face the public sector and the Council needs to adopt an entrepreneurial approach to deliver the outcomes outlined in its adopted strategy:-
      http://www.winchester.gov.uk/about/strategies 
      
      The overarching vision of Winchester City Council is to combine a blend of innovation, aspiration and pragmatism and to look beyond the traditional ways of doing things.
      The Council is committed to;
      
      • Making the District a premier business location
      • Developing quality housing with a balanced range of tenures
      • Protecting and enhancing our unique environment
      • Delivering services that encourage residents to lead healthy and fulfilling lives
      
      The outcome will be a district where everyone enjoys the opportunities and quality of life that come from living in the Winchester district. 
      
      The Framework will commence on 1st May 2019 and will be for a period of four years.
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 12;00 hrs on Monday 18th March 2019.

Title: Integrated Impact Assessment Services - AWARD
Description:
Winchester City Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for Integrated Impact Assessment Services.
      
      Winchester City Council has started work on a new Local Plan which will replace and roll forward its existing Local Plans. The new Local Plan will cover the Winchester District excluding the South Downs National Park, which has its own adopted local plan.
      
      The Council is seeking to appoint suitably qualified Consultants to undertake an Integrated Impact Assessment (IIA) that fulfils the requirement for a Sustainability Appraisal (SA), Strategic Environmental Assessment (SEA), Equalities Impact Assessment (EIA) and Health Impact Assessment (HIA) and Habitats Regulations Assessment. By taking this integrated approach it avoids the need to undertake and report on separate assessments and it seeks to reduce any duplication of assessment work and benefits from a shared understanding of the outputs to inform policy development, particularly to reflect those elements such as climate change, green infrastructure, transport etc which cut across a variety of planning matters. 
      
      The Contract will commence on 26 May 2020 and will be for a period of 3 years.
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 12:00 hrs on Friday 24 April 2020

Title: Provision of Archaeological Services - AWARD
Description:
Winchester City Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for the Provision of Archaeological Services. 
      
      The principle aims of work identified are as follows: 
      • To define and understand the deposit characteristics and hydrogeological context of the CWR site and the vulnerability of waterlogged deposits of archaeological interest to changes in the water environment. 
      • To provide a preliminary assessment of the state of preservation of waterlogged organic deposits and the artefacts / ecofacts that they contain. 
      • To provide detailed baseline information about the existing water environment of the CWR site and likely state of preservation of buried archaeological remains, against which the implications of future development proposals can be assessed and evaluation strategies developed. 
      
      The Contract will commence on 1st June 2020 and will be for a period of two years (with the option to extend for a further six years).
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 1400 hrs on Monday 30th March 2020).

Description:
Winchester City Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for the Provision of Works under Disabled Facilities Grants.

Title: Winchester Sport and Leisure Centre - Leisure Management Contract - AWARD
Description:
Winchester City Council is seeking to procure an experienced leisure operator for its 15 year leisure management contract to operate the new Winchester Sport and Leisure Centre. This state of the art, wet and dry centre located at Bar End, Winchester will replace River Park Leisure Centre, a facility which has reached the end of its intended life.
      
      The new centre will comprise of the following facilities:
      • 8 lane x 50m main swimming pool
      • 20m x 10m learner pool
      • hydrotherapy pool
      • splash pad
      • 200-station health and fitness suite
      • spinning studio
      • 8-court sports hall
      • 4 squash courts
      • 2 activity studios
      • clip and climb
      • 8 treatment rooms
      • café.
      
      The contract will also include the adjacent Winchester Sports Stadium, which is home to a 400m, 8-lanesynthetic athletics track, 100m x 60m artificial grass pitch and a clubhouse.
      
      The contract falls within Schedule 3 of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 and is being procured via a hybrid of an open type procedure with the Council reserving the right to negotiate at its sole discretion.
      
      The Contract will commence on 01 May 2021 and will be for a period of 15 years (with the option to extend for a further 5 years).
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 14:00 hrs on Friday 09 November 2018.

Title: Care and Support at Home Tier 2
Description:
Care and Support at Home Tier 2 is a call-off which has been run under the Help to Live at Home Open Framework, set up under the light touch regulations, Tier 2 is available for all providers accepted onto the framework to apply for. When applying for tier 2 providers need to pass a number of pass/fail questions relating to the service they deliver. In addition they need to submit a consolidated hourly rate for all zones they wish to provide care in. Providers are able to set up to three rates for each zone they wish to work in. A standard rate which must be between £15 and £20 and two enhanced rates. There are no caps on the enhanced rates providers can set.
Once accepted onto tier 2 there is no guarantee of any packages. All packages of care will be offered to the tier1 contract in the zone first. Only those packages which the tier 1 provider can not accept will be referred to tier2. A competition will then be run where all providers accepted onto tier 2 can bid for the package at the rates they set in their originally tender submission.
Tier 2 is always open for providers to join.  A closing date and award date prior to the contract start date has been added to enable completion of this form however the opportunity is open till the 30th June 2025 and providers will be awarded contracts throughout this period

Title: Enterprise M3 Fund Management - AWARD
Description:
Enterprise M3 LEP is looking to procure a suitably qualified supplier to manage the Fund Management contract and administer loan, equity and short-term trade finance funds.
      Enterprise M3 is a business-led local enterprise partnership, one of 38 in England, which is working to secure economic growth at the sub-national level. The LEP brings together leaders from the business, public and not-for-profit sectors and provides the vision, knowledge and strategic leadership needed to drive sustainable private sector growth.
      
      Since July 2014, Enterprise M3 has operated a loan and equity fund known as the Enterprise M3 Funding Escalator which was funded through the Enterprise M3 Growing Enterprise Fund. The investment period for the Funding Escalator comes to an end in June 2018 and Enterprise M3 are currently looking to secure a provider who can administer a larger and more complex fund from June 2018 onwards and enter into the Enterprise M3 the Fund Management contract for that purpose.
      
      No further information is available at present. You are however able to express your interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and locating this prior information notice, in the tenders tab, then Current and scroll down to the project. 
      
      Once the tender is live (mid January 2018), you will receive notification to view the tender documentation.

Title: Oral Health Improvement Services
Description:
The service will coordinate, facilitate, support and deliver a range of evidence-based interventions to improve oral health and reduce oral health inequalities within key target groups in Hampshire including:

•	The continued provision and development of a targeted supervised tooth brushing programme and oral health award scheme for 0-5 year olds in early years settings 
•	Targeted provision of toothbrushes and paste by health visitors and other early years practitioners
•	Provision of online and/or face to face oral health promotion training and support for practitioners working with vulnerable adults and older people
•	Provision of the fieldwork for the biennial dental public health epidemiology programme oral health survey of five-year-old children, in accordance with national protocols

This contract has been let for 3 years, with an extension period of up to 2 years. The maximum available contract length is 5 years.

Description: This notice of contract award is for the purpose of transparency only and applies to the award of a contract for the provision of registered residential care services in the Fareham area within Hampshire, supporting people with learning disabilities for a period of up to 12 months. This followed serving of notice by the previous incumbent provider and the urgent need to ensure service continuity to the vulnerable client group (adults with learning disabilities). The contracted capacity is for 10 units. The service provider is  additionally required to undertake work to make application during this time to CQC (Care Quality Commission) for the service to de-register and as necessary undertake associated consultation and preparatory work with service users, their support networks, staff and relevant other stakeholders, and to complete this process within the contract period. Service provision will be delivered in accordance with the Health and Social Care Act 2008 (Regulated Activities) Regulations 2014.The contracted hours incorporating sleep-ins equates to 488 for the service provision as a whole.

Title: Care and Support at Home - Tier 1
Description:
This was a call-off run under the Help to Live at Home Open Framework, and was available to all providers who had been accepted onto the framework. The call off was published on the 23rd March and closed on the 8thMay, This was the only opportunity to be a Tier 1 provider unless any contract was not awarded or is terminated early
The Council have divided the County in 15 geographical zones and were seeking domiciliary care providers to work in these areas. Providers were able to submit tenders for as many zones as they wanted to. The call off was evaluate on the basis of most economically advantageous tender with 35% of the marks based on the providers hourly rate for the zone and the other 65% based on their responses to quality questions.
The contracts have an initial term through to the 30th June 2025 and include options to extend by up to a further two years.
Tier 1 provider will receive all referrals first, any packages of care they do not accept will be referred to the tier 2 providers in that zone. There are no guarantees of number of referrals being made or the number of packages any provider will accept. The total value of the procurement has been set at £1 to £407,700,000 on the basis it is unknown how many packages of care will be placed at Tier 1. The maximum value is based on the Council's annual spend on domiciliary care in 2017/18 multiplied by the life of the contract. The value for individual contracts is estimated at 1/15th of this value

Title: Covid 19 Response - PPE
Description:
The Covid 19 pandemic is placing unforeseen and immediate pressures on the Councils existing resources. The WACS solution is an automated service that can make multiple phone calls to named individuals, confirming their identity and asking questions the answers to which will determine the most appropriate access route for that individual to Council services. 
The aim of the Wellbeing Automated Call Service (WACS) is to reduce the requirement for the Welfare Support Team (tier 2) in HCC to make thousands of calls to individuals who have registered on the government website as extremely vulnerable and requiring support. In addition, the WACS project aims to contact those people who have been listed on the NHS Shielding List and whom HCC does not have an email or mobile number for, meaning mass communication is not possible.

Title: B990 Fordingbridge Bypass Half-Joint Investigation
Description:
B990 Fordingbridge Bypass carries the A338 single carriageway over River Avon. The bridge is a single span portal, comprising reinforced concrete cantilevers with a suspended composite deck central span supported in form of half-joints.  

Previous inspections have shown defects across the edges of both (north & south) half-joints due to degraded sealant over the expansion joints and ingress of water. These defects, however, have not been fully examined closely due to access constraints. 

This contract therefore is to undertake detailed half-joint investigation and concrete testing. The results will form a key design input into a maintenance scheme being developed to ensure increased durability/serviceability of this bridge. The contract will not only provide more detail into the identified defects, but will also try to identify if there are internal defects and assess the extent of these in order to appraise the appropriate repairs.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb:

Title: Gen 3 - 1 - Land off Forest Oak Drive, New Milton - G3 1 HCC 047 - AWARD
Description:
Dear Sir/Madam,
      
      In accordance with the Generation 3 Framework One Civil Engineering, Highways & Transportation Infrastructure Works you are invited to tender for the realignment of the existing hammerhead in Forest Oak Drive to make provision for a new access that will serve a proposed assisted living centre at Forest Oak Drive, New Milton and have been supplied with the attached documents.

Title: REACT Services - Winchester - AWARD
Description:
The REablement and Assessment of Care Team (REACT) Service is a reablement service offering time limited support that is designed specifically around an individual’s needs to maximise their long term independence. 

The service will develop a reablement plan with the aim of maximising a person’s health, well being and independence, taking into account all the elements that are important to maintaining independence. These elements are many and varied and include use of assistive technology, aids and adaptations as well as those elements that maintain the dignity and self respect of the individual such as the skills, motivation and confidence to care for oneself and live a fulfilling and meaningful life.

This service aims to ensure that people are supported to live lives that are meaningful to them and ensure that they do not simply become passive recipients of services but active participants in their reablement programme resulting in longer term improvements to the quality of their lives.

Title: Eastleigh Complex
Description:
This contract Award Notice is for the purpose of transparency only. To deliver outcomes to service users and other stakeholders. 
This contract will deliver Specialist Support Work, under the Fluctuating Needs criteria. 
The service will:
Plan and deliver outcomes focused, person centred support to service users. 
Provide a level of support which is appropriate to the needs of the service user, with a focus on independence and personalised outcomes.
Reduce dependency on support provided by paid carers. 
Safeguard Vulnerable Adults including robust support planning, risk assessment and risk management. 
Work in partnership with service users, health and social care professionals and other stake holders to ensure that effective communication with service users is central to service delivery. (This might include the use of communication systems such as Makaton, PECS or British Sign Language and the use of assistive / augmentative technology).
Monitor the delivery and quality of support and review support arrangements where applicable.
Work alongside the service user, their family and circle of support, health and social care professionals and other stakeholders to develop co-produced services.
Support service users to build social capital by leading active, healthy, socially responsible and socially inclusive lives as part of their local communities.
Maintain a socially inclusive approach to support, which seeks to develop the use of local community networks and opportunities for service users.
Use proactive and non aversive strategies to support service users to manage their emotional wellbeing and reduce behaviours which may limit life opportunities.
Support service users to make informed choices about their life, promoting self advocacy.
Support service users to take positive risks and manage identified risks in an enabling way.
Support service users to look after their home and belongings and to manage home ownership, a tenancy or licence to avoid eviction and repeat homelessness.
Act as an advocate, or enable those accessing the service to self-advocate, in the resolution of problems that have negative impacts on the stability of Service Users’ housing or future housing options.
Support services users to maximise their income.
Support service users to manage personal money and a household budget.
Support service users to be aware of their financial responsibilities and support access to services such as credit unions, rent deposit schemes and to establish debt and savings plans.
Support service users to plan and prepare meals and drinks where appropriate.
Support service users with personal care, including the provision of direct support if this is required.
Support service users to keep healthy, manage medication and interact with Health professionals.
Provide support for Palliative care interventions where required and within appropriate commissioning arrangements.

Title: Enterprise M3 Advisor Network
Description:
Enterprise M3 is a business-led Local Enterprise Partnership (one of 39 English LEPs) that is working to secure economic growth at sub-national level. We bring together leaders from the business, public and not-for-profit sectors and provide the vision, knowledge and strategic leadership needed to drive sustainable private sector growth.

Our aim is to create the foundations on which our businesses can flourish. We strive to improve business productivity, increase jobs and maximise the number of businesses operating across Enterprise M3. The link between schools, colleges and employers is seen as particularly important for developing our workforce for the future. 

The Enterprise M3 area stretches from the hinterland of London to the New Forest. It covers four major interconnected urban centres – Woking, Guildford, Farnborough and Basingstoke, the city of Winchester, significant centres such as Camberley and Staines-upon-Thames and areas with growth potential such as Andover, Aldershot, Whitehill & Bordon.

Organisation Name: MINISTRY OF HOUSING, COMMUNITIES & LOCAL GOVERNMENT
Title: Provision of Secretariat Services supporting Aggregate Working Parties
Description:
The Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government (the Authority) has had contracts in place for the provision of Secretariat Services supporting Aggregate Working Parties since 2015. There are 9 Aggregate Working Parties, 1 for each of the 9 local authority area clusters across England. The role of the secretariat function is to enable these Working Parties to fulfil their functions in monitoring the operation of the Managed Aggregate Supply System (MASS). 

The contracts covering the 9 area clusters were due to expire on 
31 March 2019. However, the Authority has extended these contracts for a further 12 months, until 31 March 2020. The extensions will secure the continued provision of the services provided by the Aggregate Working Parties' secretariats while the Government considers its future role in supporting the sector. 
Securing the continued provision of the services provided by the Aggregate Working Parties' secretariats for 2019-20 will enable mineral planning authorities to continue to positively plan for aggregates.

Title: Children's Services Commissioner in Buckinghamshire
Description:
The Department is responsible for supporting improvement in local authorities, through government intervention, in response to failure or weakness in the provision of children's social care services. This is done in part through drawing down external expertise, from various sectors, to support local authorities in these circumstances. 
The Department wishes to appoint a Commissioner to undertake a review in Buckinghamshire County Council. The Commissioner will play a high profile role in a challenging political and delivery environment. They will bring their extensive and proven skills in children's social care transformation to delivering a robust assessment as to how improvements to services for the most vulnerable children can best be secured within the local context. In doing so they will set expectations for how services can best be delivered outside of council control, leading and brokering relationships with senior council leaders and their partner organisations. Alongside this, they will direct work to secure urgent improvements to ensure that children in the Authority are safe.

Title: ESF 2014-2020 Programme Support for NEET and those likely to become NEET aged 15-24
Description:
The ESFA is currently working with Local Enterprise Partnerships (LEPs) and their European Structural Investment Fund (ESIF) committees, on the provision of an Opt-in offer to deliver Education and Training through the ESF 2014-20 programme against a number of the programme Investment Priorities.

IP 1.2 Support for NEET and those likely to become NEET aged 15-24

The activities will support young people aged 15 -24 who are Not in Employment Education or Training (NEET) or are likely to become NEET with individualised programmes of learning and support, to overcome identified barriers to participation in education and support their transition toward sustained employment.

Title: LS0039 LAWYERS IN LOCAL GOVERNMENT SOUTHERN BRANCH
Description:
The Participating Authorities are seeking to enter into framework agreements ('Contracts') with a number of external legal providers, and are inviting tenders from organisations interested in being selected for the external provision of legal services under call-off arrangements for one or more of the following areas of work ('Lots'):
Lot 1 - Planning 
Lot 2 - Property 
Lot 3 - Employment
Lot 4 - Commercial 
Lot 5 - Civil and Criminal Litigation
Lot 6 - Adult Services
Lot 7 - Childcare Services
Lot 8 - General Local Government Matters 
Lot 9 - Monitoring Officer Support
The objective of entering into such framework agreements is to support the Participating Authorities existing in-house legal teams.	
Following evaluation of the tenders and approval of the outcome the Participating Authorities intend to appoint a maximum of 8 Suppliers for each Lot. Each appointed tenderer will be required to enter into a Contract with the Participating Authorities. Call off contracts will be awarded by direct award.

Title: Contract(s) for the provision of Governance Leadership Development and/or Clerking Development across the 8 Regional School Commissioner (RSC) regions of England between 2017-18 and 2019-2020
Description:
The Department for Education (DfE) intends to procure contract(s) to deliver Governance Leadership Development and/or Clerking Development to the boards of state-funded institutions providing education to children of compulsory school age across the 8 Regional School Commissioner (RSC) regions of England between 2017-18 and 2019-2020. 

The aim of the contract(s) is to build the capacity of governing boards across the country through a focus on supporting chairs to drive change in their boards and professionalising the quality of clerking support.

This procurement pertains to establishments that are maintained by a local authority (LA) and those establishments with whom the Secretary of State has entered into academy arrangements, including primary and secondary maintained schools and academies, special schools and special academies, free schools, UTCs, studio schools and alternative provision institutions that are LA maintained or are academies. It does not cover further and higher education providers such as 6th Form Colleges, FE Colleges and Universities, or educational institutions outside of England.
Attachments: 1453 Governance leadership and clerking development ITT.docx 1453 Governance leadership and clerking development Instructions to bidders.docx 1453 Governance leadership and clerking development evaluation criteria.docx 1453 Governance leadership and clerking development drafte contract.docx 1453 Governance leadership and clerking invoice data leadership.xlsx 1453 Governance leadership and clerking invoice data clerking.xlsx 1453 Governance leadership and clerking development marketing and branding guidelines.docx 1453 Governance leadership and clerking development volumes and costs clerking amended 6.9.2917.xlsx 1453 5_volumes_and_costs_leadership (updated 14_09_17).xlsx NGA_leadership.pdf NGA_clerking.pdf Entrust_clerking.pdf Entrust_leadership.pdf FASNA_clerking.pdf FASNA_leadership.pdf SDSA.PDF GovernEd.pdf HCC.PDF Marches.pdf
Additional Text:
The contract will run from November 2017 to March 2019 with provision to extend up to twice for a further one-year period.

The estimated total value of funding available to contractors is up to £2.4m in 2017-2019 with the possibility of up to £1.45m additional funding in 2019-2020 and 2020 - 2021 subject to possible contract extensions and the availability of funding.

The invitation to bid will be  managed through the DfE e-procurement system, REDIMO2. Bidders who are not already registered on REDIMO2, will need to register their company details on the DfE e-procurement portal in order to access this tender opportunity. Information about how to register is available at: https://supplierlive.proactisp2p.com/account/login/?cid=DFE
Please e-mail our helpdesk Commercial.contactpoint@education.gov.uk if you have any queries with registering your details on REDIMO2.

Title: Contract Award - TENDER FOR THE SUPPLY AND/OR SUPPLY, INSTALLATION & MAINTENANCE OF SIGNAGE ACROSS HAMPSHIRE UNDER A FRAMEWORK AGREEMENT
Description:
Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council (the council) is acting as lead authority on behalf of the Hampshire & Isle of Wight Procurement Partnership ('HIOWPP'), comprising of: • Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council • East Hampshire District Council • Eastleigh Borough Council • Fareham Borough Council • Gosport Borough Council • Hampshire County Council • Hart District Council • Havant Borough Council • Isle of Wight Council • New Forest Borough Council • Portsmouth City Council • Rushmoor Borough Council • Test Valley Borough Council • Winchester City Council Other authorities that are part of this process comprise: • Town and Parish Councils within Hampshire • Junior, Primary and Secondary Schools in the Hampshire County Council local authority area, (private schools are not included in the Framework) The main objective of the HIOWPP was to establish a framework, potentially with multiple suppliers to cover the needs of each organisation that uses the framework. The framework comprises the supply of various types of signage, ranging from very small quantities (one item) to larger orders. As requirements differ for each organisation, the contract will comprise of 'supply only' and/or 'supply and installation' Lots The framework has been split into four Lots as detailed below • Lot 1 - Street Name Plates - supply only • Lot 2 - Street Name Plates - supply and installation/maintenance • Lot 3 - Road Signage (incl. directional signs, information signs etc.) - supply only • Lot 4 - Road Signage (incl. directional signs, information signs etc.) - supply and/or Installation/maintenance 
Tenderers were advised that the Council would not award more than one supplier per Lot, but Tenderers were able to bid for one or more lots. The council has entered into contract(s) with the successful tenderer of each Lot for a period of 4 years.
The Council utilised an electronic tendering tool to manage this procurement and communicate with Tenderers. Accordingly, no hard copy documents were issued to Tenderers and all communications with the Council, including the submission of Tenderers' Responses, were conducted via the ProContract system, which can be accessed using the following link: http://sebp.due-north.com

Title: Day to Day Building Maintenance Framework
Description:
The Isle of Wight Council ("the Authority") invites Tenders from suitably qualified providers for the provision of a single supplier day to day building maintenance Framework Agreement ("framework"). The framework is to run from 01 December 2016 for a period of 4 years subject to the Framework Agreement between the Authority and the awarded supplier. This framework is primarily intended for use by the Isle of Wight Council at its own corporate premises and facilities.

Notice Identifier: DN128199 PQQ Opportunity Joint Venture Partner for the Manydown Project
Title: PQQ Opportunity Joint Venture Partner for the Manydown Project
Description:
Manydown is a government-recognised transformational housing project comprising an area of approximately 843 ha (2,080 acres) west of Basingstoke, which could ultimately see the delivery of 7,800 homes in total in the current local plan period and beyond and is being developed in a manner that is consistent with 'garden town' principles. The initial phases of the Manydown project have been allocated for at least 3,200 (with potential for this to be increased by 10% up to 3,250) private and affordable dwellings in the first phase with the potential to develop a further 4,600 dwellings in future phases, subject to satisfactory performance during phase1, community accommodation together with associated infrastructure and commercial/retail space. Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council and Hampshire County Council ('the councils'), acting as joint land owners, wish to deliver the project in conjunction with a partner through a joint venture arrangement. The partner, or consortium of partners, will bring expertise, creativity and financial resources to the development.

The purpose of this opportunity is to find a joint venture partner to enter into a 50/50 joint venture vehicle ('JV'). The selected JV partner will have the financial capability, technical resource and experience to deliver a new neighbourhood of the highest quality. The councils' aim is to incentivise its JV partner to take a long-term approach with strong placemaking at the heart of the delivery strategy. This approach will deliver a high quality new community, whilst also creating value and financial returns. It is envisaged that the councils will participate in the JV through a corporate special purpose vehicle (councils' SPV') . The councils intend to contribute certain land interests to the JV (subject to satisfaction of certain conditions). 

This procurement process is being conducted in accordance with the Public Contract Regulations 2015 using Competitive Dialogue. The OJEU Contract Notice was notified on 8 July 2016 (temp. TED Ref: 2016-087904). A Prior Information Notice (PIN) was published on 12 May 2016 (S:2016/S 092-165132).

The Council is utilising an electronic tendering tool to manage this procurement and communicate with Tenderers.  Accordingly, there will be no hard copy documents issued to Tenderers and all communications with the Council, including the submission of Tenderers' Responses, will be conducted via the ProContract system, which can be accessed using the following link: http://sebp.due-north.com
Please note expressions of interest must be registered before 11:30:00 Wednesday 24 August 2016. 
Completed tenders and supporting information should be returned no later than 12:00:00 on Wednesday 24 August 2016.

Title: TENDER FOR THE PROVISION OF PILOT SOCIAL INCLUSION AND HOMELESSNESS SERVICES LOT 4
Description:
Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council (the council) is committed to provide first class services and facilities and to protecting our most vulnerable residents. The council are seeking to commission pilots for social inclusion and homelessness services for 2017- 2019 to best meet local needs and deliver positive outcomes. The pilots have come about following agreement between the council and Hampshire County Council (HCC), whereby grant funding previously attributable to Supporting People will be combined with the council's own revenue resources. The aims and objectives of the services will be: (i) To provide a flexible and responsive crisis intervention and prevention service to vulnerable people with support needs who are homeless or at risk of becoming homeless that improves health and wellbeing, supports social inclusion and reduces the likelihood of them needing adult social care services. (ii) To provide holistic support that prevents homelessness and repeat homelessness, and the loss of independence through tenancy breakdown, hospital admission, custody or other forms of institutionalised care. (iii) To target individuals and families at an early stage and provide interventions which prevent escalation of need and sustain an individual's current housing situation where it is safe to do so. (iv) To enable people to develop their capacity to live independently so as to be able to maintain independent accommodation without the need for intensive support at the earliest appropriate opportunity. (v) Support people who are in housing crisis with support needs during a period of change in their life/condition/circumstances with the express aim of increasing their level of independence. The tender consists of four Lots, for each of the services required and these are as follows: • Lot 1 - Social Inclusion Partnership Fundraising, Income Generation and Campaigns • Lot 2 - Emergency Access Homelessness Accommodation and Support • Lot 3 - Community Floating Support and Homelessness Prevention • Lot 4 - Making Every Adult Matter (MEAM) Rough Sleeper Outreach The council proposes to enter into contract(s) with the successful tenderer(s) of each Lot for a period of 2 years, with an option to extend for two further periods of 12 months each. Tenderers can bid for one or more Lots.

The council is utilising an electronic tendering tool to manage this procurement and communicate with Tenderers.  Accordingly, there will be no hard copy documents issued to Tenderers and all communications with the council, including the submission of Tenderers' Responses, will be conducted via the ProContract system, which can be accessed using the following link:

Title: TENDER FOR THE PROVISION OF PILOT SOCIAL INCLUSION AND HOMELESSNESS SERVICES LOT 3
Description:
Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council (the council) is committed to provide first class services and facilities and to protecting our most vulnerable residents. The council are seeking to commission pilots for social inclusion and homelessness services for 2017- 2019 to best meet local needs and deliver positive outcomes. The pilots have come about following agreement between the council and Hampshire County Council (HCC), whereby grant funding previously attributable to Supporting People will be combined with the council's own revenue resources. The aims and objectives of the services will be: (i) To provide a flexible and responsive crisis intervention and prevention service to vulnerable people with support needs who are homeless or at risk of becoming homeless that improves health and wellbeing, supports social inclusion and reduces the likelihood of them needing adult social care services. (ii) To provide holistic support that prevents homelessness and repeat homelessness, and the loss of independence through tenancy breakdown, hospital admission, custody or other forms of institutionalised care. (iii) To target individuals and families at an early stage and provide interventions which prevent escalation of need and sustain an individual's current housing situation where it is safe to do so. (iv) To enable people to develop their capacity to live independently so as to be able to maintain independent accommodation without the need for intensive support at the earliest appropriate opportunity. (v) Support people who are in housing crisis with support needs during a period of change in their life/condition/circumstances with the express aim of increasing their level of independence. The tender consists of four Lots, for each of the services required and these are as follows: • Lot 1 - Social Inclusion Partnership Fundraising, Income Generation and Campaigns • Lot 2 - Emergency Access Homelessness Accommodation and Support • Lot 3 - Community Floating Support and Homelessness Prevention • Lot 4 - Making Every Adult Matter (MEAM) Rough Sleeper Outreach The council proposes to enter into contract(s) with the successful tenderer(s) of each Lot for a period of 2 years, with an option to extend for two further periods of 12 months each. Title: TENDER FOR THE PROVISION OF PILOT SOCIAL INCLUSION AND HOMELESSNESS SERVICES LOT 1
Description:
Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council (the council) is committed to provide first class services and facilities and to protecting our most vulnerable residents.  

The council are seeking to commission pilots for social inclusion and homelessness services for 2017- 2019 to best meet local needs and deliver positive outcomes. The pilots have come about following agreement between the council and Hampshire County Council (HCC), whereby grant funding previously attributable to Supporting People will be combined with the council’s own revenue resources.

The aims and objectives of the services will be:

(i) 	To provide a flexible and responsive crisis intervention and prevention service to vulnerable people with support needs who are homeless or at risk of becoming homeless that improves health and wellbeing, supports social inclusion and reduces the likelihood of them needing adult social care services.

(ii) 	To provide holistic support that prevents homelessness and repeat homelessness, and the loss of independence through tenancy breakdown, hospital admission, custody or other forms of institutionalised care.

(iii) 	To target individuals and families at an early stage and provide interventions which prevent escalation of need and sustain an individual’s current housing situation where it is safe to do so.

(iv) 	To enable people to develop their capacity to live independently so as to be able to maintain independent accommodation without the need for intensive support at the earliest appropriate opportunity.

(v) 	Support people who are in housing crisis with support needs during a period of change in their life/condition/circumstances with the express aim of increasing their level of independence.

The tender consists of four Lots, for each of the services required and these are as follows:

•	Lot 1 – Social Inclusion Partnership Fundraising, Income Generation and 
Campaigns

•	Lot 2 – Emergency Access Homelessness Accommodation and Support 

•	Lot 3 – Community Floating Support and Homelessness Prevention 

•	Lot 4 – Making Every Adult Matter (MEAM) Rough Sleeper Outreach

The council proposes to enter into contract(s) with the successful tenderer(s) of each Lot for a period of 2 years, with an option to extend for two further periods of 12 months each. Tenderers can bid for one or more Lots.

Title: Contract Award-PR and Communication Services for the Manydown Project, Basingstoke
Description:
Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council (‘BDBC’) and Hampshire County Council (‘HCC’) are the leaseholders of approximately 840 hectares of land at Manydown, near Basingstoke. BDBC and HCC are in the process of procuring a consortium of consultants to prepare a Detailed Masterplan and submit a Planning Application for the first phase of the Manydown project that is defined as the site allocation contained in the emerging Local Plan.

This particular requirement relates to BDBC and HCC jointly commissioning PR and Communication Services for the Manydown project to support the development of a detailed masterplan and the submission of an outline planning application for the first phase of the project.

The services will cover:
•	Public Engagement
•	Public Consultation
•	Communications strategy, including the creation and preparation of marketing documentation, advice on and implementation of effective engagement and consultation methods

The Council utilised an electronic tendering tool to manage this procurement and communicate with Tenderers.  Accordingly, no hard copy documents were issued to Tenderers and all communications with the Council, including the submission of Tenderers’ Responses, were conducted via the ProContract system, which can be accessed using the following link:
	
https://www.businessportal.southeastiep.gov.uk

The contract has been awarded on the basis of the most economically advantageous tender.

Title: Heritage advice and archaeological support - Southsea - AWARD
Description:
Portsmouth City Council is inviting expressions of interest from suitably qualified and experienced providers to tender for this project. 
      
      The services to be provided under the term contract could include, but may not be limited to: 
      o Provide expert heritage and archaeological advice to the Employer during the next stages of design, in which the current conceptual design will be further developed to a sufficient level of detail to obtain planning permission, and subsequently to full detailed design. The Consultant shall support the Employer in satisfying the requirements of this Scope and address the issues and concerns raised by key heritage stakeholders including Portsmouth City Council's Conservation Officer, Hampshire County Council's Historic Environment Team, and Historic England.
      o Provide support to the Employer and draft applications for heritage related licences and consents.
      o Produce written schemes of investigation (WSIs) for all required stages of site investigations and construction works.
      o Provide an archaeological watching brief for site investigations and construction works.
      o Produce a Heritage Statement for the planning permission application.
      o Produce an Archaeological Mitigation Strategy for the planning permission application.
      o Undertake environmental sampling, laboratory testing and analysis of samples where required.
      o Provide advice and support to the Employer in cases where discovery of material is made on site.
      o Preparation of deposit models, where required.
      o Reporting.  
       
      Although this contract is being let for use on the Southsea Coastal Defence scheme, should there be a requirement that the Employer requires assistance on one of the other schemes it is running during the contract term; they reserve the right to ask the successful Supplier if they wish to bid for the work. Any additional Services will be inline with the values detailed within the OJEU notice.
      
      The initial contract period will be for 7 years extendable to a maximum of 8 years, subject to performance and agreement of all parties. 
      
      The closing date for receipt of your expression of interest is given against the heading entitled - Date documents can be requested until.
